com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document

Class SpenObjectLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectBase
      • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectShapeBase
        • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectLine

  • public final class SpenObjectLine
extends SpenObjectShapeBase
    Line object class

    A SpenObjectLine represents one of straight line, elbow line and curve line.

    The SpenObjectLine has the 2 magnet connection points on a begin point and an end point.
    The SpenObjectLine can connect to a magnet connection point of SpenObjectShape, SpenObjectTextBox or SpenObjectImage object.
    A magnet connection point of SPenObjectLine can connected to a single magnet connection point of SPenObjectShape, SpenObjectTextBox or SpenObjectImage object.

    The SpenObjectLine has from 0 to 3 control points for changing the path of the line.
    The number of control point of SPenObjectLine is changed according to the path of SpenObjectLine.
    And the path of ObjectLine is changed according to position and rect of connected objects.

    The SpenObjectLine has a rotation angle. If the begin or end connector is moved, the rotation angle is changed to 0.

    The SpenObjectLine can have a line style and color effect.
    Since:
    4.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SpenObjectLine.Properties
      Properties Class.
      This is a utility class for making a candidate path of SpenObjectLine.
      The path of SpenObjectLine depends on its connector position and connected shape.

      • moveControlPoint

        public void moveControlPoint(int index,
                             PointF point)
        Move a specified control point.
        The line has variable control points according to the shape of the line. The straight line has 0 control point. The elbow and curve line have 0 ~ 3 control points.
        The line has specific path shape, so basically control point can move only vertical or horizontal. It depends on line shape or connection state. In this reason, input point can be different from getControlPoint(int) return value.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of control point. It starts from 0.
        point - The position of new control point.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the index is negative value or if it is greater than the number of control points of current line.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the point is null.
        Since:
        4.0.0

      • getControlPoint

        public PointF getControlPoint(int index)
        Get a current position of the specified control point.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of control point. It starts from 0.
        Returns:
        The position of specific control point.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the index is negative value or if it is greater than the number of control points of current line.
        Since:
        4.0.0

      • connect

        public void connect(int connector,
                    SpenObjectShapeBase targetShape,
                    int indexOfTargetMagneticConnectionPoint)
        Connect a specified connector to the magnetic connection point of specified shape.
        If the connector is already connected at indexOfTargetMagneticConnectionPoint position, it doesn't do anything.
        If the connector is already connected to another object, it should be disconnected first and then connect to the targetShape. The line can only connect to an object which is appended to the same SpenPageDoc.
        Parameters:
        connector - Connector to connect. It is one of CONNECTOR_BEGIN or CONNECTOR_END.
        targetShape - Target shape to connect.
        indexOfTargetMagneticConnectionPoint - Index of the specified magnetic connection point of the target shape.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the connector is invalid.
        Thrown if the targetShape is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the indexOfTargetMagneticConnectionPoint is negative value or if it is greater than the number of magnetic connection points of connected shape.
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if the targetShape isn't appended to the same SpenPageDoc.
        Since:
        4.0.0
        See Also:
        CONNECTOR_BEGIN, CONNECTOR_END

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(int connector)
        Disconnect connected shape from specific connector.
        Parameters:
        connector - Connector to disconnect. It is one of CONNECTOR_BEGIN or CONNECTOR_END.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the connector is invalid.
        Since:
        4.0.0
        See Also:
        CONNECTOR_BEGIN, CONNECTOR_END
